body.name: TP-Link AC4000 Tri-Band WiFi Router (Archer C4000) -MU-MIMO, VPN Server, 1.8GHz CPU, Gigabit Ports, Beamforming, Link Aggregation

features: Tri Band Wireless Internet Router for 4K video, streaming and gaming with incredible high speed, 1625 Mbps on both 5 GHz bands and 750 Mbps on 2. 4 GHz band
Archer C4000 with Powerful 1. 8 GHz 64-bit CPU, three co-processors and 512 MB of RAM powers your home network. Works as a great gaming router.
Eliminate buffering with MU-MIMO technology letting you connect more devices simultaneously. Multiple requests and accelerate loading Times.
Range boost technology enables far reaching Wi Fi for long range coverage throughout the Home. Supported Operating Systems: OS Independent Up to Windows 10, Mac OS 10. 12 and Linux
Advanced security: Protect your network and connected devices with a free lifetime subscription to TP-Link HomeCare­ featuring next-level antivirus, robust parental controls, and QoS.
Gigabit Wired Speeds-1 WAN and 4 LAN gigabit ports bring wired speeds to the maximum and Link Aggregation even doubles it to 2 Gbps
Works with all internet service providers, such as AT&T, Verizon, Xfinity, Spectrum, RCN, Cox, CenturyLink, Frontier, etc.( a modem is required for most internet service providers)
body.description: Archer AC4000 delivers combined tri-band Wi-Fi speeds of up to 4, 000 Mbps to satisfy your diverse Wi-Fi demands and keep your network operating at top speed. NitroQAM boosts speeds on all bands by 25% while Smart Connect and Airtime Fairness work together to provide smoother Wi-Fi experience without lag. Buffering will never be a problem again. With tri-band Wi-Fi and MU-MIMO Technology, Archer C4000 communicates with multiple devices at the same time, sending and receiving data on the best available band. Enjoy a non-stop MOBA or FPS game while your family watches 4K videos online—lag free. Equipped with six high-performance antennas and Beamforming technology to detect connected devices and concentrate wireless signal strength towards them. RangeBoost technology creates a strong Wi-Fi signal throughout your house, greatly improving your network coverage. All Gigabit Ethernet ports (1 WAN+ 4 LAN) bring wired speeds to the maximum. Plug your PCs, smart TVs and game consoles into one of the four Gigabit Ethernet ports for fast and reliable wired connections. Link Aggregation empowers your network-attached storage (NAS) devices by combining two separate Ethernet ports into a 2Gbps connection.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Premium WiFi Performance Enjoy a premium WiFi performance with the Archer C4000. It comes with an unbelievably powerful processor and is packed with state-of-the-art features such as MU-MIMO, Tri-Band, NitroQAM, and TP-Link HomeCare. Enjoy explosively fast long range WiFi for more devices with the Archer C4000.

Airtime Fairness Airtime Fairness ensures your faster devices are not limited by slower devices on your network, keeping them operating at top speeds. More Connections with MU-MIMO MU-MIMO enables your router to work with several devices simultaneously so that everyone can hop online at once and experience a smooth connection**. Speed Boost with 1024-QAM 1024-QAM increases the amount of data sent through your router, giving you a speed boost of up to 25% over previous generations. Smart Connect Smart Connect automatically steers your devices towards the optimal band, giving you a faster network with no extra work required.
Go Faster with Tri-Band Speeds Use not just two but three networking highways to accelerate your network speeds and minimize disruptions. Reach combined speeds of up to 4.0 Gbps*.

Far-Reaching WiFi Coverage From the bedroom to the basement to the backyard, the Archer C4000 delivers stronger WiFi across your home. Together Beamforming and RangeBoost provide far-reaching coverage throughout your home.

Access 2 Gbps Wired Connection Link Aggregation combines two LAN ports to boost connection speed giving you to access to a 2 Gbps wired connection to your NAS and other devices. VPN Server Create a server at home and a secure connection to it so you can safely browse the internet and access your files when you’re away. Works with Alexa Turn on/off guest WiFi with Alexa voice control. Easy Setup and Management Set up the Archer C4000 in minutes and manage via the intuitive web interface or the powerful Tether app (available on Android or iOS).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have now had a couple of these routers (one got toasted in a lightning strike). It has been rock solid and has not required any reboots or resets since I got it. Set up was easy, and I have since bought a second one to use as a repeater to spread the signal further out into our one acre yard. Love this product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice replacement router
reviews.reviewText: I replaced another router that died on me. This one has been a nice upgrade and hasn't given me any issues in the months I've owned it. I get a strong signal in the other room where the computer is. Moreover, the connection on this is as good as an ethernet cable for download speeds.I will add here, that if I recall, thinking back, it failed to get a good speed until I switched on both the 2.4 and the 5.0 bands despite the literature suggesting one or the other. As if they complement each other. Ever since, it's worked great on two computers with my 200 mb download speed over wireless.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I almost return this router... BUT
reviews.reviewText: At first I was very disappointed... it will not connect to my Xfinity account. It said connected but no internet. I try to mimic the old setup from my old wifi rounder and still no go, very frustrating. I was so mad. I then thought maybe I can turn it into a Access Point piggy backing to the old router, and it works, I finally got internet connection. But that is not what I intended it to be. So I try again, and again, and again. Ready to give up...Then my new ARRIS SURFboard SB8200 arrive and let see if the new TP-Link will work together with the new Arris modem. I then called Xfinity to activate the new modem and still no internet. According to the Tech the new modem is activated and it should be working already. I then look at my Xfinity phone app and notice that the old modem is still showing in the account. Also, the app is finally seeing the new modem and asking if I want to activate: which at first it wasn't that is why I called Xfinity to activate. I then went through the activation process and once I refresh my screen it finally showing the correct modem model SB8200. In my surprised the new Tp-Link WiFi router is also see the internet and connected. I was very happy...Now I can setup both NEW and OLD wifi router the way I wanted them to be. New for PC and Games, Old for Camera, Security and Lights. I piggy back the old wifi router to TP-Link and change the channel to 6 (keeping the old router and resetting it with same SSID help speed-up the connection on all previous devices). Now I'm getting the speed I paying for and more...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you can follow instructions, this is easy!
reviews.reviewText: I’m a nurse not an IT person..so I was afraid I’d not be able to install this. BUT, I started reading and there was a website to complete the installation, so I followed the instructions ( which were very simply worded) and wow, it worked! I did it! I had some buffering at first but finally, everything meshed and that went away. I am pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well and easy to configure; range good but not spectacular
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I needed more range (and OpenVPN) and because a friend has been selling them and reported that he was getting spectacular range from them. I found it easy to install, and the VPN came right up when I configured it, but the range was not as spectacular as I'd hoped. It's a little better than the $30 router it is replacing, but it doesn't cover my entire (small) house with a strong signal, nor does it reach to my detached garage.I also don't like that configuring the router requires setting up an online account. Maybe that gives me some benefit, but I don't know what that would be, and I suspect it's just another example of companies adding "features" that benefit them but not the user.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Trouble prone from start up...
reviews.reviewText: For some context, I run a home business and rely heavily on transferring very large data files wireless from my laptop. I've never used TP-Link in the past, but this had decent reviews so I figured I would give it a try. I'm now regretting that decision. I went through to set up process per the instructions. Everything fired right up and all three channels were active. I have 20 plus devices on the network at both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. I set up all three SSIDs the same as my previous router. Expecting them to either instantly connect with this new router or possibly need a reboot and/or refreshing of the network credentials to connect.My 2.4 gigahertz items would either not connect at all, or would connect and disconnect intermittently. My first thought was possible interference on the default channels or using too wide a bandwidth for each channel leading to increased interference. So, I checked the spectrum in my area and selected the best available channels for both frequencies and made the changes as I always do. For the record, I'm an RF engineer with over 20 years experience.So now that I am using the clearest possible frequencies and my RSSI is booming, I expect to have decent performance. Unfortunately, this was not the case. My 2.4 gigahertz equipment still would not connect or was experiencing intermittent drops. All of my 5 GHz equipment connected with no issues but still intermittently dropped.I made the decision to contact technical support as a sanity check and because nobody can know everything about every piece of equipment. They answered the phone promptly and the technician was courteous. Unfortunately, he led me through the settings and asked me to Make a few changes I didn't necessarily agree with in regards to the channels and bandwidth. I went along with it and tried it but It made no difference. He then asked me to watch it for 24 hours to see if it got better. If not, I was requested to email them back instead of calling. What kind of customer support asks you to wait 24 hours when you are currently experiencing issues and then to contact them by email and hope they get back to you in a reasonable time?So, overall I can say without hesitation that I am not satisfied with this product or their support and will not be buying any of their equipment in the near future. I'm not sure what the issue was, but suspect it wasn't able to handle the 20 or so clients I had attached with all three channels active (2.4, 5.0 #1, and 5.0 #2) due to inadequate processor power and/or memory.So for a simple network with a few clients in a relatively clean RF environment, this might work fine. That being said, who doesn't have many neighbors with Wi-Fi and multiple clients on their network such as phones, security cameras, Amazon echoes, tablets, laptops, gaming systems, etc.?Purchase at your own risk...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good to have 3 bands
reviews.reviewText: Third band helps to keep the speed up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love TP Link
reviews.reviewText: Everything went well, the people knew what there doing,you got a customer rep fast and were very helpful.
